predicate.note: Frames file for 'require' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'need' and 'ask'

roleset.name: need

example.name: active
example.text: Being so fragile and minute, they will require special special robotic handling equipment.

example.name: with ablative
example.text: It may be the largest [settlement] ever required *trace* of a state or local utility.

example.name: sentential complement
example.text: The 1988 trade act requires Mrs. Hills to issue another review of the performance of these countries by April 30.
example.arg: to issue another review of the performance of these countries by April 30.

roleset.note: Splitting the clause up (in contrast to the treatment in 'need') is necessary because require predicates can be passivized, while 'need' predicates cannot

example.name: passivized
example.text: Sea Containers' subsidiaries might be required *trace* to place their shares in the open market.
example.arg: to place their shares in the open market.

roleset.note: Compare to "The FCC needed Sea Containers' subsidiaries to place their shares on the open market" and "*Sea Containers' subsidiaries were needed to place their shares on the open market". The latter is grammatical, but means something different.
